intro: Stachytarpheta longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicelled blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that appear in dense, showy clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are primarily visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance in supporting pollinator populations. Stachytarpheta longipedicellata is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
